column4: Earnings lift Wall St. to record highs; dollar fall continues
column5: NEW YORK Strong earnings from Intel and other companies drove Wall Street indexes to record closing highs on Friday  while the U.S. dollar remained weak after recent comments by the U.S. Treasury secretary.

column4: Intel  healthcare shares boost lift Wall St. to record
column5: NEW YORK The latest round of strong earnings reports  including from Intel and AbbVie  along with continued weakness in the dollar lifted each of the major Wall Street indexes to closing records on Friday. | Video

column4: Intel shares hit dotcom-era highs after bumper results
column5: Intel Corp's  shares rose 7 percent on Friday to their highest in almost two decades  after strong results offered the clearest sign yet that its years-long effort to shift away from a slowing PC business was paying off.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Intel shares hit dotcom-era highs after bumper results
column5: Jan 26 Intel Corp's shares rose 7 percent on Friday to their highest in almost two decades  after strong results offered the clearest sign yet that its years-long effort to shift away from a slowing PC business was paying off.

column4: CORRECTED-Intel shares hit dotcom-era highs on robust data center demand
column5: Jan 26 Intel Corp's shares rose 6 percent on Friday to levels last seen during the dotcom boom 17 years ago  after strong results offered the clearest sign yet that its years-long effort to shift away from a slowing PC business was paying off.
